segments.text: In foreign trade , language differences are very important .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . If people can not communicate with each other easily , they can not understand each other's way of thinking .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Fortunately , there is a widely-spoken commercial language , namely English .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Many exporters speak French and German as well .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In South America , the most common language is Spanish and Portuguese .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Even if the language is accurate , a misunderstanding can not be avoided due to cultural differences .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , the language is a part of culture . It reflects a nation's character .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it not only includes the nation's historical and cultural background , but also contains the nation's view of life way of life and way of thinking .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So in foreign trade , you must be very clear about language differences .
segments.speaker: S1
